posts.title: High Speed Internet In Benton County
posts.content:
A town hall meeting is taking place this Friday, Dec. 3 to discuss high speed internet in Benton County. 

  • To hear the people: Though Benton County is perceived to have high speed internet, there are areas that do not have the broadband coverage that others do. The meeting is taking place to hear from residents and find out where internet problems can be addressed. 
  • Individual contribution: A survey has been sent out for Benton County residents to fill out so advancements can be made in the mission to make the area as technologically accessible as possible, as the internet is becoming a basic need.

Read the full KNWA story HERE.

posts.title: AIDS Memorial Quilt Panels In Fayetteville
posts.content:
St. Paul’s Episcopal Church in Fayetteville put on display part of the largest piece of community folk art in the world and will have it through Friday, Dec. 3. 

  • Remember: Four panels of the AIDS Memorial Quilt are in the church featuring the 42 known Arkansans that have been memorialized out of the 105k who lost their lives in the AIDS epidemic 40 years ago. The quilt as a whole is a 54-ton tapestry with 50k panels.
  • Panels: Though we only have a portion of the quilt, you can see it in its entirety through an interactive image. You can also volunteer to keep the quilt safe at St. Paul's. 

For more information about the quilt, click HERE.

posts.title: Farmers Market Online
posts.content:
After last year’s farmers market delay due to health precautions, the Downtown Bentonville Farmers Market App became an essential part of the market experience and is now a year round option for a modern experience. 

  • Online browsing: Shoppers and vendors can participate in an online Farmers Market, where all the fresh vegetables, local meats, and artisanal goods can be accessed on the smartphone app or website. 
  • Easy as 1, 2, 3: It’s a great way to support our local farmers and growers year round and to have easy, weekly access to locally grown and healthy food. Customers can checkout in a single transaction and pick up their order every Thursday without leaving their car.

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Lights In NWA
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas streets are lighting up all around us and they make for a wonderful night out for a stroll. 

  • It's lit: Every downtown square around is lit and decorated for the holidays, a couple of local families have outshone the rest of the neighborhood, and some local farms are stepping it up with their holiday decor. 
  • Into the woods: Don’t forget about the North Forest Lights, an immersive light show experience in the forest around Crystal Bridges. If it’s not already, this walk through the woods might just become your new holiday tradition. 

For more Christmas lights and events, click HERE.

posts.title: Winter Markets @ Record
posts.content:
More community markets are coming to Bentonville this season! 

  • A platform: The downtown venue, Record, is going to host markets with an array of rotating local artists, musicians, and food vendors on Saturday mornings from 9a-noon through March 12 starting this Saturday, Dec 4.
  • Winter market: The Market @ Record will be a space for the community to gather during the colder months to socialize and support local producers. There will be mimosas and beer for the adults and crafts for the kids. Santa will be there this Saturday and Dec.18. 

Click HERE for more information.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Sam's club: Another merry little pop-up is in Bentonville Today.
  • Only in Arkansas: An all dinosaur themed light display is ready for you to see.
  • An honor: Dancers from NWA will perform in Pearl Harbor's 80th Memorial Parade.
  • See them live: There's always more coming to the Walmart AMP. You won't be disappointed.
  • Stories to share: We want to feature you in our newsletter! Ask us about our advertising deals.
